articles.author: Josh Smith, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: A defiant South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol faces a second impeachment vote on Saturday over his short-lived attempt to impose martial law, a move that shocked the country, split his party and imperilled his presidency half way through his term.
articles.title: South Korea's Yoon faces second impeachment vote over martial law bid

articles.author: Jack Kim
articles.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol faces the greatest threat to his brief but chequered political career, with his fate in the hands of judges after some of his allies turned from him and voted to impeach him on Saturday for allegedly leading an insurrection.
articles.title: South Korea's Yoon impeached: Embittered survivor buckles under martial law backlash

articles.author: Joyce Lee
articles.description: Prime Minister Han Duck-soo, who became South Korea's acting president after Saturday's impeachment of Yoon Suk Yeol, is a career technocrat whose wide-ranging experience and reputation for rationality could serve him well in his latest role.
articles.title: Who is Han Duck-soo, South Korea's acting president after Yoon impeachment?

articles.author: Erin Banco, Jonathan Landay
articles.description: In the early days of 2013, an American man, dressed in ragged clothing, dodged between houses in the streets of Damascus’ upscale Mazzeh neighborhood looking for a civilian to take him to safety after more than five months of captivity in the concrete cells of a local prison.
articles.title: Austin Tice: a clue from 2013 in search for US reporter missing in Syria

articles.author: Joyce Lee
articles.description: gSouth Korea's Constitutional Court controls President Yoon Suk Yeol's fate, after parliament impeached him on Saturday over his short-lived martial law decree last week.
articles.title: Explainer: South Korea's Constitutional Court to decide impeached president's fate

articles.author: Tuvan Gumrukcu
articles.description: A Russian cargo plane departed from Russia's air base in the Syrian port city of Latakia for Libya on Saturday, a Syrian security official stationed outside the facility said, following rebels' overthrow of President Bashar al-Assad last weekend.
articles.title: Russian cargo plane departs Syria for Libya, more flights expected, official says

articles.author: Bulent Usta, Tuvan Gumrukcu
articles.description: Thousands gathered in northwestern Syria on Friday for weekly prayers and a rally where clerics in the port city of Latakia, a former stronghold of ousted President Bashar al-Assad, urged national unity under the country's new government.
articles.title: Syrian clerics in former Assad stronghold call for national unity, democracy

articles.author: Simon Lewis, Huseyin Hayatsever
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Turkish Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan agreed on Friday on the need for continued efforts to counter any resurgence of Islamic State in Syria following the fall of Bashar al-Assad.
articles.title: Blinken, in Turkey, discusses Islamic State in Syria, Gaza ceasefire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran will not impede U.N. nuclear watchdog's access and inspection of its sites, the head of the country’s Atomic Energy Organization said on Saturday.
articles.title: Iran will not impede IAEA access, head of its atomic organisation says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Greek authorities have recovered the body of a man and rescued 39 migrants from the sea after their boat capsized off the southern island of Gavdos in the Mediterranean, its coastguard said on Saturday.
articles.title: One dies after boat capsizes off Greek island, many feared missing
